arts.ttl: Mateta hat-trick earns Palace draw in thriller against Bournemouth
arts.sum: Jean-Philippe Mateta scores a hat-trick as Crystal Palace fight back from two goals down to draw 3-3 with Bournemouth in a thrilling game at Selhurst Park.

arts.ttl: Late DRAMA as Mateta hat-trick caps six-goal Palace-Bournemouth EPIC
arts.sum: Highlights from the Premier League match between Crystal Palace and Bournemouth.

arts.ttl: Mateta sparks sensational Palace comeback to deny Bournemouth top spot
arts.sum: Jean-Philippe Mateta stole the show at Selhurst Park with a stunning hat-trick as Crystal Palace fought back from two goals down to draw 3-3 with Bournemouth in one of the most dramatic games of the Premier League season so far.

arts.ttl: Jean-Philippe Mateta’s hat-trick rescues Crystal Palace in thrilling draw with Bournemouth
arts.sum: For most of this breathless encounter, Bournemouth supporters were relishing the prospect of going top of the Premier League, albeit potentially only for a few hours, and inflicting only Crystal Palace’s second home defeat of 2025. Andoni Iraola’s impressive side had led through two goals from teenager Eli Junior Kroupi before being pegged back by Jean-Philippe Mateta and thought they had won it when substitute Ryan Christie scored with two minutes of normal time remaining. Continue reading...

arts.ttl: Crystal Palace 3-3 AFC Bournemouth: Jean-Philippe Mateta hat-trick salvages draw
arts.sum: Jean-Philippe Mateta scores a hat-trick, including a stoppage-time penalty, as Crystal Palace fight back from two goals down to draw with Bournemouth.

arts.ttl: Premier League LIVE: Ange Postecoglou sacked by Nottingham Forest, five games to come
arts.sum: Reaction as Ange Postecoglou sacked by Nottingham Forest, plus live text and radio commentary of five Premier League games at 15:00 BST.

arts.ttl: Bournemouth XI vs Crystal Palace – Predicted Lineup and Team News
arts.sum: Bournemouth travel to Selhurst Park on Saturday on the verge of a historic milestone. The Cherries are enjoying their best-ever start to a Premier League season. Consequently, a victory over Crystal Palace would mark their 100th win in the competition’s history. Andoni Iraola’s side should be full of confidence heading to the capital. arts.ttl: Crystal Palace v Bournemouth: Premier League Preview, Gameweek 8, 2025
arts.sum: Palace return from the international break looking to respond after their first defeat of the season; a late 2-1 loss away to Everton that ended their remarkable 19-game unbeaten run in the league. Two of the Premier League ’s surprise packages meet this weekend, as high-flying Bournemouth travel to face an equally confident Crystal Palace side in South London.

arts.ttl: Pre-Match Analysis: High-flying Bournemouth face in-form Crystal Palace
arts.sum: Bournemouth have been unbeaten since their opening league fixture against Liverpool, whilst Palace come into the game off the back of their first loss; a late Jack Grealish winner for Everton ending the Eagles’ 19-game unbeaten streak. Defensively, both teams are impressive, each keeping three clean sheets and conceding under ten goals, with Palace boasting the joint-second best record with just five.
